name: Poha
steps: Rinse poha in water and drain.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, and peanuts.
Add chopped onions and sauté till translucent.
Add turmeric and salt, then add poha.
Mix well, cook for 2-3 minutes, and garnish with coriander and lemon juice.

name: Idli with Coconut Chutney
steps: Soak and grind rice and urad dal to make batter. Ferment overnight.
Pour batter into idli molds and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Grind coconut, green chilies, and roasted chana dal to make chutney.
Temper chutney with mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Serve idlis hot with chutney.

name: Aloo Paratha
steps: Prepare dough using wheat flour and water.
Boil and mash potatoes with spices like cumin, garam masala, and coriander.
Stuff potato mixture in dough and roll out gently.
Cook on a tawa with ghee till golden brown on both sides.
Serve with curd or pickle.

name: Thepla
steps: Knead wheat flour with methi leaves, spices, curd, and a little oil.
Roll into thin discs like chapati.
Cook on a tawa with ghee or oil till golden.
Serve hot with pickle or yogurt.

name: Moong Dal Chilla
steps: Soak moong dal for 2 hours and grind to a smooth batter.
Add ginger, green chili, and salt.
Pour on a tawa like dosa and cook with little oil.
Serve with chutney or ketchup.

name: Dhokla
steps: Prepare a batter with besan, curd, and water.
Add ENO fruit salt just before steaming.
Steam in a greased plate for 15 minutes.
Temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies in oil.
Pour over sliced dhoklas and serve.

name: Rava Idli
steps: Roast rava in ghee and cool.
Mix with curd, grated carrot, chopped coriander, and ENO.
Pour into greased idli molds and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Serve with coconut chutney.

name: Sabudana Khichdi
steps: Soak sabudana for 4-6 hours, then drain.
Heat ghee, add cumin seeds, green chilies, and peanuts.
Add soaked sabudana and salt, mix gently.
Cook until transparent and garnish with coriander and lemon.

name: Uttapam
steps: Use fermented dosa batter.
Pour thick batter on tawa and top with chopped onions, tomatoes, and chilies.
Drizzle oil around and cook on both sides.
Serve with chutney or sambar.

name: Bread Upma
steps: Cut bread into cubes.
Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, tomatoes, and spices.
Add bread cubes and toss gently.
Cook for 2-3 mins and garnish with coriander.

name: Rajma Chawal
steps: Soak rajma overnight and pressure cook until soft.
In a pan, sauté onions, ginger, garlic, and tomatoes.
Add cooked rajma and spices like garam masala, cumin, and chili powder.
Simmer for 15–20 minutes until gravy thickens.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Baingan Bharta
steps: Roast brinjal on open flame until soft and peel skin.
Mash and set aside.
In a pan, sauté onions, tomatoes, garlic, and green chilies.
Add mashed brinjal, salt, and garam masala.
Cook for 5–7 minutes and garnish with coriander.

name: Matar Paneer
steps: Fry paneer cubes lightly and set aside.
In oil, sauté onions, tomatoes, and ginger garlic paste.
Add green peas, paneer, and spices.
Add water and simmer until peas are cooked.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

name: Kadhi Pakora
steps: Make gram flour pakoras and fry until golden.
Whisk curd with gram flour, turmeric, and water.
Cook the mixture on low flame, stirring constantly.
Add pakoras and temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and red chilies.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Aloo Tamatar ki Sabzi
steps: Boil and cube potatoes.
In a pan, sauté cumin seeds, ginger, and green chilies.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and red chili powder.
Add potatoes and cook until soft.
Garnish with coriander.

name: Lauki Chana Dal
steps: Soak chana dal for 1 hour and boil.
Sauté onions, tomatoes, and spices.
Add chopped lauki and cooked dal.
Simmer until lauki is soft.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Jeera Rice
steps: Heat ghee and fry cumin seeds until aromatic.
Add soaked basmati rice and sauté gently.
Add water and salt, cover, and cook until done.
Fluff with fork and serve.

name: Chana Masala
steps: Soak and boil chickpeas until soft.
Sauté onions, tomatoes, and ginger garlic paste.
Add spices like chole masala, cumin, and chili powder.
Add chickpeas and cook until thickened.
Garnish with coriander.

name: Tinda Masala
steps: Peel and chop tinda.
Sauté cumin seeds, onions, and tomatoes.
Add tinda, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt.
Cook covered until tender.
Garnish with coriander.

name: Palak Dal
steps: Pressure cook dal with turmeric and green chilies.
Sauté garlic, onions, and tomatoes in ghee.
Add chopped spinach and cook for 5 minutes.
Add to cooked dal and simmer.
Serve with rice.

name: Pav Bhaji
steps: Boil vegetables like potatoes, peas, and carrots.
Mash them and cook with butter, onions, tomatoes, and pav bhaji masala.
Toast pav buns with butter on a tawa.
Serve bhaji hot with pav, chopped onions, and lemon.

name: Misal Pav
steps: Cook sprouted matki beans with spicy masala gravy.
Top with farsan and chopped onions.
Serve hot with buttered pav and lemon.

name: Kanda Poha
steps: Rinse poha and let it sit.
Sauté mustard seeds, green chilies, and onions.
Add turmeric and salt, then mix in poha.
Cook for a few minutes and garnish with lemon and coriander.

name: Vegetable Sandwich
steps: Butter bread slices and apply green chutney.
Layer sliced cucumber, tomato, beetroot, and potato.
Sprinkle chaat masala and cover with another slice.
Grill or toast and serve.

name: Bread Pakora
steps: Make potato filling with spices.
Stuff between two bread slices and dip in gram flour batter.
Deep fry until golden brown.
Serve with chutneys.

name: Chole Kulche
steps: Boil white chickpeas and prepare spicy chole masala.
Heat kulche with butter.
Serve chole with onion salad and lemon.

name: Egg Bhurji with Toast
steps: Scramble eggs with onion, tomato, and spices.
Cook until fluffy and garnish with coriander.
Serve with buttered toast.

name: Batata Vada
steps: Prepare spiced mashed potato filling.
Dip balls in gram flour batter and deep fry.
Serve with chutneys or in pav as vada pav.

name: Rava Uttapam
steps: Make batter with rava, curd, and water.
Pour on tawa and top with onions, tomatoes, and chilies.
Cook until golden and serve with chutney.

name: Sabudana Thalipeeth
steps: Mix soaked sabudana, mashed potatoes, and spices.
Flatten and cook on tawa until crisp.
Serve hot with curd or chutney.

name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices for 6 hours.
Cook chicken in a tandoor or pan until browned.
Prepare creamy tomato-based gravy with butter and spices.
Add chicken to gravy and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with cream and coriander before serving.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
steps: Marinate meat with yogurt, fried onions, and biryani spices.
Partially cook basmati rice separately.
Layer meat and rice, add saffron milk and ghee.
Seal and cook on dum for 45 minutes.
Serve hot with raita.

name: Dal Tadka
steps: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric.
In ghee, temper cumin, garlic, onions, and tomatoes.
Add cooked dal and simmer for 5 minutes.
Top with ghee tempering of red chili and garlic.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Malai Kofta
steps: Prepare koftas using paneer and potatoes, deep fry till golden.
Make creamy tomato-cashew gravy with spices.
Add koftas before serving and garnish with cream.

name: Chicken Chettinad
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices.
Sauté onions, tomatoes, and Chettinad masala.
Add chicken and cook until tender.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice.

name: Gobi Paratha
steps: Prepare dough using wheat flour.
Grate cauliflower and mix with spices.
Stuff in dough balls, roll, and cook on tawa with ghee.
Serve with curd or pickle.

name: Veg Pulao
steps: Sauté whole spices, onions, and mixed vegetables.
Add soaked basmati rice and water.
Cook covered until rice is done.
Garnish with coriander and serve.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
steps: Sauté onions, tomatoes, and cashews, blend into a smooth paste.
Cook paste with butter and spices.
Add paneer cubes and cream, simmer briefly.
Serve with naan or rice.

name: Fish Curry with Rice
steps: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt.
Prepare gravy with coconut, tamarind, onions, and spices.
Add fish and simmer till cooked.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Methi Thepla with Yogurt
steps: Mix wheat flour, chopped methi, yogurt, and spices.
Knead into dough and rest.
Roll and roast on tawa till golden.
Serve with yogurt and pickle.

name: Gulab Jamun
steps: Mix khoya, maida, and baking soda to form a soft dough.
Make small balls from the dough and deep fry on low heat until golden brown.
Prepare sugar syrup with water, sugar, cardamom, and rose water.
Soak the fried balls in warm sugar syrup for at least 1 hour.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Falooda
steps: Cook falooda sev as per packet instructions and chill.
In a glass, layer soaked basil seeds, sev, rose syrup, and cold milk.
Top with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Garnish with chopped nuts and a cherry.
Serve chilled with a spoon and straw.

name: Rasmalai
steps: Boil milk and curdle it using lemon juice to make chenna.
Knead chenna and form flat balls, then cook in sugar syrup.
Prepare thickened milk with saffron and cardamom.
Add the cooked balls to this milk and let it soak for 1-2 hours.
Garnish with pistachios and chill before serving.

name: Kheer
steps: Wash and soak rice for 30 mins.
Boil milk and add soaked rice, cook on low flame till soft.
Add sugar, cardamom powder, and chopped dry fruits.
Simmer until kheer thickens to desired consistency.
Serve warm or chilled.

name: Sheera
steps: Roast semolina (sooji) in ghee until golden and aromatic.
Boil water with sugar and cardamom, add to roasted sooji.
Stir continuously to avoid lumps and cook till thick.
Add chopped nuts and raisins.
Serve hot garnished with saffron strands.

name: Mango Shrikhand
steps: Strain curd in a muslin cloth for 4-5 hours to get thick hung curd.
Whisk hung curd with powdered sugar and mango pulp.
Add cardamom powder and mix well.
Chill for a few hours in the refrigerator.
Serve garnished with chopped pistachios.

name: Gajar ka Halwa
steps: Grate carrots and cook in a pan with ghee.
Add milk and cook on medium flame till reduced.
Stir in sugar and cardamom powder.
Cook until mixture thickens and ghee separates.
Garnish with dry fruits before serving.

name: Kalakand
steps: Boil milk and curdle to get chenna, drain and mash.
In a pan, mix chenna with condensed milk and cook until thick.
Pour into a greased tray, level the surface.
Garnish with pistachios and let it set for a few hours.
Cut into squares and serve.

name: Seviyan Kheer
steps: Roast vermicelli in ghee until golden.
Boil milk and add the roasted vermicelli.
Cook until soft, then add sugar and cardamom powder.
Add chopped nuts and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve warm or chilled.

name: Jalebi
steps: Prepare a batter with maida, curd, and a pinch of baking soda. Ferment overnight.
Make sugar syrup flavored with saffron and cardamom.
Pour batter in spiral shapes in hot oil and fry until golden.
Dip immediately into warm sugar syrup for a few seconds.
Serve hot and crispy.

name: Sprouted Moong Salad
steps: Steam sprouted moong slightly or keep raw if preferred.
Mix with chopped onion, tomato, cucumber, and green chili.
Add lemon juice, salt, and chaat masala.
Garnish with coriander leaves.
Serve chilled as a healthy snack.

name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch spinach and blend into a smooth puree.
Sauté cumin, garlic, and onion in oil, then add spinach puree.
Add salt, garam masala, and paneer cubes.
Simmer for 5 minutes on low heat.
Serve hot with roti or brown rice.

name: Oats Upma
steps: Dry roast oats and keep aside.
Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, and vegetables.
Add water and bring to boil, then add oats.
Cook while stirring until water is absorbed.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

name: Carrot and Beetroot Raita
steps: Grate carrot and beetroot.
Mix with whisked curd, salt, and roasted cumin powder.
Add chopped coriander and green chili if desired.
Chill in the refrigerator before serving.
Serve with paratha or pulao.

name: Lauki Soup
steps: Peel and chop bottle gourd (lauki).
Boil with garlic, ginger, and onion until soft.
Blend to smooth puree and simmer with salt and pepper.
Add cumin powder for flavor.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

name: Quinoa Khichdi
steps: Rinse and boil quinoa with moong dal until soft.
Sauté cumin, ginger, vegetables in ghee.
Add boiled quinoa-dal mixture, turmeric, and salt.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with curd or pickle.

name: Brown Rice Pulao
steps: Soak and cook brown rice until done.
Sauté whole spices, onion, and mixed vegetables in olive oil.
Add cooked rice and mix well.
Cover and cook for 5 more minutes.
Serve hot with raita.

name: Grilled Tofu with Vegetables
steps: Marinate tofu and vegetables in olive oil, herbs, and lemon juice.
Grill on a pan or oven till golden.
Sprinkle salt, pepper, and chili flakes.
Garnish with lemon juice and herbs.
Serve hot.

name: Cucumber Mint Raita
steps: Grate cucumber and mix with whisked curd.
Add chopped mint leaves, salt, and cumin powder.
Mix well and refrigerate before serving.
Garnish with mint.
Serve chilled.

name: Ragi Dosa
steps: Mix ragi flour with rice flour, curd, and water to make a batter.
Add chopped onions, chilies, and coriander.
Pour batter thinly on hot tawa and cook both sides.
Drizzle little oil and cook till crisp.
Serve hot with chutney.

name: Kaju Katli
steps: Grind cashews into a fine powder.
Cook sugar with water to make a 1-string consistency syrup.
Add cashew powder and cook till the mixture leaves the pan.
Roll into a thin layer and cut into diamonds.
Cool and store in airtight container.

name: Rasgulla
steps: Boil milk and curdle it using lemon juice to get chenna.
Knead the chenna until smooth and make small balls.
Boil sugar and water in a deep pot, add the balls.
Cover and cook for 15-20 mins until they double in size.
Cool and serve chilled with syrup.

name: Besan Ladoo
steps: Roast besan in ghee on low flame until aromatic.
Add powdered sugar and cardamom powder.
Mix well and let it cool slightly.
Shape into ladoos while warm.
Store in airtight container.

name: Motichoor Ladoo
steps: Make a thin besan batter and fry tiny boondis using a perforated spoon.
Soak boondis in sugar syrup flavored with saffron and cardamom.
Drain and mash lightly, then shape into ladoos.
Garnish with melon seeds or silver leaf.
Let them set before serving.

name: Peda
steps: Cook khoya in a pan until soft and thick.
Add sugar and cardamom powder, stir well.
Cool slightly and shape into small discs.
Garnish with pistachios.
Let them cool and store in fridge.

name: Coconut Barfi
steps: Mix grated coconut and condensed milk in a pan.
Cook until the mixture thickens and leaves sides.
Pour into a greased tray and level it.
Let it set and cut into squares.
Garnish with dry fruits if desired.

name: Dry Fruit Halwa
steps: Soak and grind dry fruits like dates, figs, almonds, and cashews.
Cook the paste in ghee on low flame.
Add cardamom and little sugar if needed.
Cook until mixture thickens and ghee separates.
Set in a tray and cut into pieces.

name: Chenna Poda
steps: Mix fresh chenna with sugar, semolina, and cardamom.
Add chopped dry fruits.
Pour into a greased and caramelized baking dish.
Bake till golden and firm.
Cool, slice, and serve.

name: Milk Cake
steps: Boil milk and reduce it while stirring continuously.
Add alum or lemon juice for light curdling.
Add sugar and continue cooking till thick.
Pour into greased mold and let it cool.
Cut into slices and serve.

name: Til Gud Ladoo
steps: Roast sesame seeds and keep aside.
Heat jaggery with ghee till soft-ball consistency.
Mix sesame seeds and quickly form balls.
Shape while mixture is warm.
Store in airtight container.

name: Chole Bhature
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight and pressure cook until soft.
Sauté onions, ginger, garlic, and tomatoes in oil, then add spices.
Add boiled chickpeas and simmer for 15–20 minutes.
Knead flour with yogurt, salt, and baking powder for bhature dough.
Roll and deep fry bhature until puffed and golden. Serve with chole.

name: Sarson da Saag with Makki di Roti
steps: Boil mustard leaves, spinach, and bathua with ginger and green chilies.
Mash and cook the saag with makki flour, ghee, and salt.
Knead makki flour with warm water to form dough.
Roll thick rotis and roast on tawa with ghee.
Serve hot with butter and saag.

name: Bisi Bele Bath
steps: Pressure cook rice and toor dal together.
Sauté vegetables and add bisi bele bath masala.
Mix with the cooked dal-rice mixture and add tamarind pulp.
Simmer for 10 minutes, adding water as needed.
Temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and serve hot.

name: Litti Chokha
steps: Prepare stuffing with sattu, garlic, green chili, mustard oil, and spices.
Make wheat flour dough, stuff with sattu mix, and shape littis.
Roast over charcoal or bake until browned.
For chokha, mash roasted eggplant, tomatoes, and boiled potato with mustard oil and spices.
Serve hot litti with chokha and ghee.

name: Undhiyu
steps: Make methi muthia and deep fry until golden.
Prepare mixed vegetables (yam, brinjal, surti papdi, etc.).
Cook in a green masala paste of coconut, coriander, garlic, and spices.
Add muthia and simmer until veggies are tender.
Serve hot with puri or roti.

name: Macher Jhol
steps: Marinate fish pieces with turmeric and salt, then shallow fry.
Sauté potatoes and tomatoes with panch phoron and green chili.
Add water, turmeric, and salt to make gravy.
Add fish and simmer until cooked through.
Serve with steamed rice.

name: Malabar Parotta with Kurma
steps: Knead maida with water and oil, rest, then roll and coil into layers.
Flatten and roast on a tawa with oil until flaky and golden.
For kurma, sauté onions, tomatoes, and ginger-garlic paste.
Add boiled vegetables or meat with coconut-spice paste and simmer.
Serve parotta hot with kurma.

name: Kosha Mangsho
steps: Marinate mutton with yogurt, mustard oil, and spices.
Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until browned.
Add marinated mutton and cook on low flame till oil separates.
Add little water and cook till tender (preferably in a pressure cooker).
Serve hot with rice or luchi.

name: Sambar with Rice
steps: Pressure cook toor dal until soft.
Boil mixed vegetables in tamarind water with turmeric and sambar powder.
Add mashed dal and bring to boil.
Prepare tempering with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and hing.
Pour tempering over sambar and serve with rice.

name: Bamboo Shoot Curry
steps: Boil bamboo shoots to remove bitterness and drain.
Sauté mustard seeds, onions, and green chili in oil.
Add tomatoes and cook till soft, then add turmeric and chili powder.
Add bamboo shoots and simmer in water for 10-15 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.

name: Lassi
steps: In a blender, add 1 cup of plain yogurt, 1/2 cup of cold water, and 2 teaspoons of sugar.
Blend until smooth and frothy.
Add a pinch of cardamom powder and blend again for a few seconds.
Pour into glasses, garnish with chopped pistachios or mint leaves if desired.
Serve chilled.

name: Mango Lassi
steps: Peel and chop 1 ripe mango and add it to a blender.
Add 1 cup plain yogurt, 1/2 cup cold milk, 2 teaspoons sugar, and a pinch of cardamom powder.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and optionally garnish with saffron strands or chopped nuts.
Serve chilled.

name: Masala Chai
steps: In a saucepan, bring 1 cup water to a boil with 2 crushed green cardamoms, 1 clove, a small cinnamon stick, and a few slices of ginger.
Add 1 teaspoon black tea leaves and boil for 1–2 minutes.
Add 1/2 cup milk and 1 to 2 teaspoons sugar (adjust to taste).
Simmer for another 2–3 minutes until tea is fragrant and strong.
Strain into a cup and serve hot.

name: Sol Kadhi
steps: Soak 5-6 dried kokum petals in 1/2 cup warm water for 30 minutes.
Crush and strain the kokum to extract the juice.
Blend 1 cup coconut milk with 1 green chili and 2 garlic cloves.
Mix the coconut milk with kokum extract, add salt to taste, and chopped coriander.
Serve chilled as a refreshing digestive drink.

name: Aam Panna
steps: Boil 2 raw mangoes until soft. Let them cool and peel off the skin.
Extract the pulp and blend it with 1/2 cup water, mint leaves, 1/2 tsp roasted cumin powder, black salt, and sugar to taste.
Adjust consistency by adding more water.
Serve chilled over ice, garnished with mint.

name: Thandai
steps: Soak 2 tbsp almonds, 1 tbsp poppy seeds, 1 tbsp melon seeds, and 5-6 black peppercorns in water overnight.
Grind into a fine paste with a little water.
Boil 1 liter milk, add the paste, 1/4 cup sugar, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add a pinch of saffron and crushed cardamom.
Chill and serve garnished with rose petals or chopped nuts.

name: Kokum Sharbat
steps: Soak 10–12 dried kokum in 1 cup warm water for 1 hour.
Crush and strain to extract juice.
Mix with 1/2 cup sugar, a pinch of black salt, cumin powder, and chilled water to make 4 glasses.
Stir well and serve chilled with mint leaves.

name: Badam Milk
steps: Soak 10 almonds overnight or in hot water for 30 minutes. Peel the skin.
Grind almonds with a little milk to make a paste.
Boil 2 cups milk, add almond paste, sugar to taste, a pinch of saffron, and cardamom powder.
Simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with sliced almonds.

name: Jaljeera
steps: Blend mint, coriander, ginger, black salt, regular salt, tamarind pulp, and cumin powder with a bit of water into a smooth paste.
Strain the mixture.
Add it to 2 cups of chilled water, stir well.
Add ice cubes and serve immediately, optionally garnished with a slice of lemon.

name: Filter Coffee
steps: Boil 1 cup of water in a kettle or saucepan.
Add 2 tablespoons of South Indian filter coffee powder to the upper chamber of a traditional coffee filter.
Pour the boiling water over the coffee powder, cover, and let it brew for 10–15 minutes.
Boil 1 cup of milk separately and add 2 teaspoons of sugar (optional).
Pour 1/4 cup of the brewed decoction into a cup, add hot milk, mix well and serve hot.

name: Tomato Shorba
steps: Boil 4 chopped tomatoes with 2 cups water, 1 garlic clove, and a small piece of ginger for 10 minutes.
Cool slightly and blend into a smooth puree.
Heat 1 tsp ghee, add 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, then pour in the tomato puree.
Add salt, pepper, a pinch of garam masala, and simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped coriander.

name: Mulligatawny Soup
steps: Heat 1 tbsp oil, sauté 1 chopped onion, 1 carrot, and 1 apple until soft.
Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp curry powder, and stir.
Add 1/2 cup cooked lentils and 3 cups vegetable broth. Simmer for 15–20 minutes.
Blend until smooth, add salt, pepper, and a dash of lemon juice.
Serve hot with a drizzle of coconut milk or cream.

name: Palak Soup
steps: Blanch 2 cups spinach in hot water for 2 minutes, then blend into a smooth puree.
Heat 1 tsp butter, sauté 1 chopped onion and 1 garlic clove until translucent.
Add the spinach puree, 2 cups water or broth, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Serve hot, optionally topped with cream or croutons.

name: Lentil Soup
steps: Wash 1/2 cup moong dal or masoor dal and cook with 2 cups water until soft.
In a pan, heat 1 tsp ghee, add cumin seeds, chopped garlic, and 1 green chili.
Add the cooked dal, turmeric, salt, and more water to adjust consistency.
Simmer for 10 minutes and finish with lemon juice and chopped coriander.
Serve hot.

name: Carrot Ginger Soup
steps: Sauté 1 chopped onion and 1-inch piece of ginger in oil until soft.
Add 2 cups chopped carrots and 2.5 cups water or stock.
Simmer until carrots are tender, about 15 minutes.
Blend to a smooth consistency and return to heat.
Season with salt, pepper, and a dash of lime juice. Serve hot.

name: Vegetable Clear Soup
steps: Chop 1/2 cup each of carrots, beans, cauliflower, and cabbage.
Boil the vegetables with 3 cups water or stock for 10 minutes.
Add salt, pepper, and 1 tsp soy sauce.
Mix 1 tsp cornflour with water and stir into the soup to thicken.
Simmer 5 more minutes and serve hot with spring onion garnish.

name: Sweet Corn Soup
steps: Boil 1/2 cup sweet corn kernels with 2 cups water or vegetable stock for 5 minutes.
Blend half the corn to a paste and mix back into the soup.
Add salt, pepper, and 1 tsp soy sauce.
Mix 1 tsp cornflour in water and add to the soup for thickness.
Simmer for 5–7 minutes and serve hot, garnished with spring onions.

name: Pumpkin Soup
steps: Peel and chop 2 cups pumpkin. Cook with 1 chopped onion and 2 garlic cloves in a little oil until soft.
Add 2 cups water or stock and simmer for 10 minutes.
Blend until smooth, then return to heat.
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg.
Serve hot with a swirl of cream or coconut milk.

name: Drumstick Soup
steps: Wash and cut 2 drumsticks into 3-inch pieces. Boil them in 2 cups water for 10–12 minutes until soft.
Cool slightly, scrape out the pulp with a spoon and discard the fibrous skin.
Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 garlic cloves in 1 tsp oil until soft.
Add the drumstick pulp, 1 cup water or stock, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 5–7 minutes, blend if desired for smooth texture, and serve hot garnished with coriander.

name: Beetroot Soup
steps: Boil or roast 2 medium beetroots until soft, then peel and chop.
Sauté 1 chopped onion and 1 garlic clove in olive oil, then add the beetroot and cook for 5 minutes.
Add 2 cups vegetable stock and simmer for 10 minutes.
Blend until smooth, season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Serve hot or chilled, optionally with yogurt or cream.

name: Aloo Tikki
steps: Boil and mash 3 medium potatoes.
Add 1 chopped green chili, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp amchur, salt, and chopped coriander leaves.
Mix well and shape into flat round tikkis.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the tikkis on both sides until golden brown.
Serve hot with tamarind and green chutneys.

name: Paneer Tikka
steps: Cut 200g paneer into cubes. In a bowl, mix 1/2 cup thick yogurt, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, salt, and 1 tsp lemon juice.
Add paneer, capsicum, and onion chunks. Marinate for 30 minutes.
Thread onto skewers and grill or roast in oven at 200°C for 15–20 mins, turning once.
Brush with butter and sprinkle chaat masala.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

name: Samosa
steps: Prepare dough with 1 cup maida, 2 tbsp oil, salt, and water. Rest for 30 mins.
Boil, peel, and mash 2 potatoes. Sauté with cumin, ginger, peas, garam masala, amchur, and salt.
Roll dough into ovals, cut in half, shape into cones, and fill with the potato mixture.
Seal edges and deep fry on medium heat until golden.
Serve with tamarind or mint chutney.

name: Pakora
steps: Slice onions, potatoes, or other vegetables of choice.
In a bowl, mix 1 cup besan (gram flour), 1 tsp chili powder, ajwain, salt, and water to make a thick batter.
Dip vegetables into the batter and deep fry until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

name: Dahi Puri
steps: Crack open puris and fill each with mashed boiled potatoes or sprouted moong.
Add sweet tamarind chutney and spicy green chutney.
Top with chilled beaten curd (yogurt) and a sprinkle of chaat masala.
Garnish with sev and chopped coriander.
Serve immediately before the puris turn soggy.

name: Kathi Roll
steps: Marinate paneer/chicken with yogurt, spices, and lemon juice.
Sauté marinated filling until golden and cooked through.
Prepare rotis or parathas on a tawa until warm and soft.
Spread chutney, add filling, onions, and roll tightly.
Serve hot with extra chutney or ketchup.

name: Mini Dosas with Chutney
steps: Prepare dosa batter with soaked rice and urad dal, fermented overnight.
Heat a tawa, pour small rounds of batter, spread slightly.
Drizzle oil, cook till golden and crisp on one side.
Serve mini dosas hot with coconut and tomato chutney.

name: Hara Bhara Kabab
steps: Blanch spinach, boil peas and potatoes; mash well.
Mix with spices, green chili, ginger, and bread crumbs.
Shape into kababs and coat lightly with cornflour.
Shallow fry until crisp and golden on both sides.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

name: Cheese Corn Balls
steps: Mix grated cheese, boiled corn, mashed potato, and spices.
Form small balls and coat with cornflour slurry and breadcrumbs.
Chill for 20 mins to set.
Deep fry until golden and crisp.
Serve hot with ketchup or spicy dip.

name: Masala Peanuts
steps: Mix raw peanuts with besan, rice flour, and spices.
Add a few drops of water to coat peanuts lightly.
Deep fry in batches until crisp.
Drain excess oil on tissue.
Cool and serve or store airtight.

name: Hakka Noodles
steps: Boil noodles, drain, and toss with a little oil.
Stir-fry garlic, onions, bell peppers, and cabbage on high heat.
Add noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, and chili sauce.
Toss everything well for 2–3 mins.
Serve hot, garnished with spring onions.

name: Chilli Paneer
steps: Coat paneer cubes in cornflour and shallow fry until golden.
Sauté garlic, onions, and capsicum in oil.
Add soy sauce, vinegar, green chili sauce, and water.
Toss in fried paneer, mix well, and cook briefly.
Garnish with spring onions and serve hot.

name: Manchurian Balls with Gravy
steps: Mix grated veggies with cornflour, shape into balls.
Deep fry till crisp and golden.
Sauté garlic, ginger, onions in oil; add sauces and water.
Simmer and thicken with cornflour slurry.
Add balls, cook 2–3 mins, and serve hot.

name: Paneer Tacos
steps: Cook paneer cubes with tikka masala spices and onions.
Warm taco shells or rotis lightly.
Fill with paneer mix, onions, lettuce, and chutney.
Drizzle with yogurt or mayo.
Serve immediately while crisp.

name: Tandoori Pasta
steps: Boil pasta and set aside.
Cook onions, garlic, and tomatoes in oil; add tandoori masala.
Mix in cream or curd for a rich sauce.
Add pasta and coat well.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

name: Masala French Fries
steps: Cut potatoes into fries and soak in water.
Pat dry and deep fry until golden and crispy.
Toss with chaat masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Optionally drizzle with lemon juice.
Serve hot with ketchup or mayo.

name: Schezwan Fried Rice
steps: Cook and cool rice completely.
Sauté garlic, onions, and mixed veggies on high flame.
Add schezwan sauce, soy sauce, and vinegar.
Mix in rice and stir-fry until evenly coated.
Serve hot, topped with spring onions.

name: Desi Pizza with Naan base
steps: Use naan as the pizza base.
Spread pizza sauce or spiced tomato chutney.
Top with paneer, onions, capsicum, and cheese.
Bake at 200°C until cheese melts.
Sprinkle oregano and chili flakes before serving.

name: Curried Noodle Bowl
steps: Boil noodles and set aside.
Cook onions, garlic, and ginger in oil.
Add curry powder, coconut milk, and veggies.
Simmer, add noodles, and toss gently.
Serve with lime wedges and coriander.

name: Butter Chicken Quesadilla
steps: Prepare butter chicken with rich tomato gravy.
Shred chicken and mix with thickened gravy.
Spread on one side of tortilla, add cheese.
Fold and grill until crisp and golden.
Cut into wedges and serve with mint dip.
